required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Investigate the Safety Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics of Multiple Doses of AZD1236
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomised Single Centre Phase I Study to Investigate the Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics of Oral Multiple Ascending Daily Doses of AZD1236 Tablet by a Single-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, and Single Dose Relative Bioavailability of the Oral Suspension and Oral Tablet Formulations by an Open Cross-Over in Healthy Japanese Men

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate the safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetics of multiple ascending oral doses of AZD1236 given to healthy young subjects for 13 days and to evaluate the single-dose relative bioavailability of the oral suspension and oral tablet formulations.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety and tolerability of AZD1236 by assessment of blood pressure, pulse rate, body temperature, laboratory variables, ECG and adverse events
primary_outcome.time_frame: Assessments taken at screening visit, defined timepoints pre-dose and post-dose during treatment periods and follow up visit. Volunteers will be monitored throughout the study for adverse events.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic profile: concentration of AZD1236 in blood
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Samples taken during Visit 2 in multiple dosing part at 41 points and Visit 2/3 in relative bioavailability part at 32 points.

intervention.description: 75mg once daily or 75mg twice daily will be administered in multiple dose part.
Placebo tablet matching to the active in multiple dose part.
75mg single dose will be administered in relative bioavailability part.
75mg oral suspension single dose will be administered in relative bioavailability part.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Provision of signed informed consent prior to any study specific procedures
- Body Mass Index (BMI) between 19-27 kg/m2
Exclusion Criteria:
- Receipt of another investigational drug in the 4 months before dosing in this study
- Acute illness which requires medical intervention within 2 weeks of Visit 2.
- Abnormal resting BP and pulse rate (after resting for 10 minutes). Supine blood pressure > 140 mmHg systolic or >90 mmHg diastolic, pulse<= 50 or => 90 beats per minute

responsible_party.name_title: J Andrew Lockton MRCP(UK) MD FFPM, Medical Science Director
